0.title: 2023 K'taka polls my last, won't contest from Chamundeshwari: Siddaramaiah
0.article_body: Congress leader and former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah has said that 2023 Assembly elections would be his last. "I'm making it very very clear...I will not contest from Chamundeshwari again," he added. "We will make someone a candidate, ensure that he or she wins, he or she will be a Congress candidate...I will contest from wherever I'm asked to," Siddaramaiah said.

1.title: Singers want to be like Arijit today, they're losing their identities: Mame
1.article_body: Folk artist Mame Khan has said that he doesn't want to become Arijit Singh. "Today, all singers want to be like him, and in the process, are losing their identities," he added. "I choose to maintain my voice, which is why it is valued. I also celebrate my folk roots; it's the strongest aspect [of my personality]," Mame further said.

2.title: Man who stole 50 tear gas canisters from Sri Lankan police arrested
2.article_body: A 31-year-old man was arrested for allegedly stealing 50 tear gas canisters from police during protests near Parliament in Sri Lanka's Colombo, according to media reports. The suspect, who was reportedly a mason, was arrested on Sunday from his residence, the police said. The suspect had stolen the canisters last week as security forces tried to disperse the protesters.

3.title: Rupee hits record low of 79.97 against US dollar
3.article_body: The rupee hit a record low of 79.97 against the US dollar on Monday after opening at 79.76. The Finance Ministry, while speaking about the matter said that global factors such as the Russia-Ukraine war, soaring crude oil prices and tightening of global financial conditions are the major reasons for the rupee's weakening.

4.title: ICSE Class 10 topper from Pune hears the news during a birthday party
4.article_body: The all-India ICSE Class 10 topper, Hargun Kaur Matharu from Pune, got the news about her achievement when she was celebrating her younger sister's birthday. Matharu, who scored 99.8% in the exam, is tied for the top position with three other students. She said she wants to appear for the Joint Entrance Examination (JEE) and study coding.

5.title: No GST on pre-packed, labelled food items weighing over 25 kg: Finance Ministry
5.article_body: The Finance Ministry has clarified that single packages of pre-packed and labelled food items like cereals and pulses weighing over 25 kg are exempt from 5% GST. It added that if a retail shopkeeper supplies an item in a loose quantity that was bought in a 25-kg pack from a manufacturer, its sale to the consumer will not attract GST.

6.title: History tells you Shaheen Afridi blew them away: Nasser on India's top-order
6.article_body: Ex-England captain Nasser Hussain has said Team India's top-order batters struggle against left-arm pacers. "They need to play left-arm (pacers) a little bit better. History tells you that Shaheen Afridi blew them away one evening...And Reece Topley blew them away here (at Old Trafford)," he stated. Topley dismissed Shikhar Dhawan, Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli in the final England ODI.

7.title: I have voted for NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu: Cong MLA
7.article_body: Odisha Congress MLA Mohammed Moquim on Monday said that he has voted for NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu. "It's my personal decision as I have listened to my heart which guided me to do something for the soil and that's why [I] voted for her," he added. The Opposition has fielded Yashwant Sinha as their candidate for the post.

8.title: Scindia chairs meet with heads of airline companies on safety issues
8.article_body: Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia chaired a one-on-one meeting with heads of airline companies on Monday to review flight safety norms. The Aviation Ministry also issued instructions to each airline to take steps at all levels to enhance security surveillance. These steps come after a few Indian airlines reported back-to-back incidents of emergency landings due to technical issues.

9.title: Physio loses ₹1.17 lakh to fraudsters posing as army personnel
9.article_body: A physiotherapist was cheated of ₹1.17 lakh by fraudsters posing as army personnel saying 22 CISF personnel needed physiotherapy. The Borivali West-based physiotherapist received a call from a man posing as CISF Director General to approve payment. The victim opened payment mode in his digital wallet, entered the credit card number told by the fraudster and his own UPI pin.

10.title: Protest held against Sudan's military govt over tribal clashes
10.article_body: A protest was held in Sudan's capital Khartoum on Sunday against the military government over the tribal clashes in the Blue Nile province. Security forces used tear gas against the protesters as they marched towards the Presidential Palace. This comes as a senior health official said on Sunday that the death toll from the violence has risen to 65.

11.title: Who are the 4 students who jointly secured 1st rank in ICSE Class 10 exams?
11.article_body: Four students, including three girls, jointly secured the first rank in ICSE Class 10 exams, results for which were declared on Sunday. Hargun Kaur Matharu from Maharashtra's Pune, Pushkar Tripathi from UP's Balrampur, Anika Gupta from UP's Kanpur and Kanishka Mittal from UP's Kanpur all secured the first rank with 99.8% marks. The overall pass percentage for ICSE was 99.97%.

12.title: 22-yr-old female teacher kidnapped by gym trainer in UP's Gonda
12.article_body: A 22-year-old female teacher was allegedly kidnapped by a gym trainer in UP’s Gonda district in Nawabganj region. An FIR has been filed against the suspect, according to the police. Tej Pratap Singh, SHO of Nawabganj, said people saw the teacher travelling in an e-rickshaw on Sunday evening when an SUV approached and purportedly forced her to get inside car.

13.title: 2 Kanwar Yatris returning after collecting holy water die as bus hits bike
13.article_body: Two Kanwar Yatris who were reportedly returning after collecting holy water as part of the yatra rituals, were killed after a bus allegedly rammed into the motorcycle that they were travelling on.  The deceased have been identified as Moradabad residents Rahul and Gaurav. Reports said that the two were immediately hospitalised but passed away while undergoing treatment.

14.title: Alt News' Zubair seeks urgent SC hearing to quash 6 FIRs against him
14.article_body: Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair on Monday sought an urgent listing of his plea in the Supreme Court seeking to quash all six FIRs registered against him in Uttar Pradesh for allegedly outraging religious feelings. The fresh plea of Zubair has also challenged the constitution of the Special Investigation Team (SIT) by the state government to probe the six cases.

15.title: Only Delhi govt providing respite from inflation via its schemes: Kejriwal
15.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that the Delhi government is the only one that is providing any respite from growing inflation through its many schemes. "I demand the central government to take back GST applied on materials of everyday use of basic food products, it is not right," Kejriwal added.

16.title: Yashwant called Mulayam an ISI agent, can't support him: Shivpal
16.article_body: Amid ongoing voting for Presidential polls, Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party (Lohia) chief Shivpal Yadav said that he can't back Yashwant Sinha as the latter had called Samajwadi Party (SP) patriarch Mulayam Singh Yadav 'ISI agent'. "Hardcore SP leaders...who follow [Mulayamji's] principles [won't] support a candidate who levelled such allegations," he added. Notably, SP had extended support to Sinha.

17.title: Manmohan Singh arrives in wheelchair to cast vote for Presidential poll
17.article_body: Former Prime Minister and Congress MP Manmohan Singh reached Parliament in a wheelchair to cast his vote for the Presidential election on Monday. Singh was helped by four officials to get up from his wheelchair and cast his vote. He had taken a leave of absence for the entire Winter Session of Parliament in 2021 on health grounds.

18.title: Jagdeep Dhankhar, NDA's Vice President candidate, files nomination papers
18.article_body: Jagdeep Dhankhar, former Bengal governor and now Bharatiya Janata Party-led National Democratic Alliance's nominee for Vice President, filed nomination papers on Monday. Dhankhar will compete with former Rajasthan governor and five-term parliamentarian, Margaret Alva, in the race to replace M Venkaiah Naidu as India's Vice President. Alva is the opposition's candidate for the position.

19.title: Yuvraj's '45-minute conversation' tweet for Pant after his first-ever ODI ton goes viral
19.article_body: Former India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh's tweet praising Rishabh Pant after his maiden ODI hundred has gone viral. "Looks like the 45-minute conversation made sense! Well played Rishabh Pant...that's how you pace your innings. Hardik Pandya, great to watch," Yuvraj wrote. Yuvraj's tweet indicated that he had a 45-minute conversation with the India wicketkeeper-batter over his batting.

20.title: What is the deadly Ebola-like Marburg virus disease reported in Ghana?
20.article_body: An outbreak of Marburg virus disease has been reported in Ghana. As per WHO, Marburg virus disease is a highly virulent disease that causes haemorrhagic fever, with fatality ratio of up to 88%. It's in the same family as virus that causes Ebola. A type of fruit bat, Rousettus aegyptiacus, is considered to be the natural host of the virus.

21.title: Ranbir always caught my attention with his work: 'Shamshera' director
21.article_body: 'Shamshera' director Karan Malhotra has said that he is happy that he got to work with actor Ranbir Kapoor so early in his career. "Ranbir always caught my attention with his work...the timing was correct...things just fell into place for us," he added. Karan stated that Sanjay Dutt is like a family and added he didn't have any drama.

22.title: Hardik was unlucky not to be 'Player of the Match' in 3rd ODI: Hogg
22.article_body: Following India's five-wicket win against England in third ODI, Brad Hogg said all-rounder Hardik Pandya was unlucky not to be adjudged 'Player of the Match' after Rishabh Pant(125*) was named the one. He added that Hardik showed a "brilliant" all-round performance with four crucial wickets and a strike rate of 129.09 with the bat. Hardik scored 71 in 55 balls.

23.title: Vegetable supply dips in Mumbai, cauliflower touches 100/kg: Report
23.article_body: The overall supply of vegetables in Mumbai’s wholesale market dropped by 40%, a trader at the Agriculture Produce Market Committee (APMC) said. The reasons which led to the dip in supply of vegetables are heavy rainfall, one-day token strike against 5% GST followed by weekend. The prices of cauliflower touched ₹100 per kg in retail, reports said.

24.title: Police produces 120 accused in Kallakurichi court over violence in town
24.article_body: Tamil Nadu Police on Monday produced 120 accused in Tamil Nadu's Kallakurichi court in connection with the violence that erupted in the town on Sunday. The violence erupted over the death of a class 12 girl who allegedly died by suicide, alleging torture by teachers. The protesters broke barricades, stormed the school premises, and set buses on fire, reports said.

25.title: Outbreak of deadly Ebola-like Marburg virus disease declared in Ghana
25.article_body: Ghana has declared the country's first outbreak of deadly Ebola-like Marburg virus disease after two cases were identified for the first time in the African nation. A 26-year-old male and a 51-year-old male passed away due to the virus in southern Ashanti region of Ghana. More than 90 contacts of the deceased patients have been identified and are being monitored.

26.title: Army Captain, junior officer killed in accidental grenade blast in J&K
26.article_body: Army Captain Anand and Junior Commissioned Officer (JCO) Naib Subedar Bhagwan Singh were killed in an accidental grenade blast, which took place along the Line of Control in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch on Sunday late night, officials said. According to PRO Defence Lieutenant Colonel Devender Anand, the blast happened when Indian Army troops were performing their duties in Mendhar sector.

27.title: I'm not the one to try and run before I can walk: Buttler on captaincy
27.article_body: England white-ball captain Jos Buttler has said he needs "time and experience" as skipper after England lost both the T20I and the ODI series to India. "I'm not one to try and run before I can walk," stated Buttler. "I'm an experienced cricketer but I'm a young captain...I've got lots to learn, lots to try and work out," he explained.

28.title: SpaceX launches 53 Starlink satellites in its 31st mission of 2022
28.article_body: SpaceX launched a batch of 53 Starlink satellites atop a Falcon 9 rocket in its 31st mission this year on Sunday. This was the 13th flight for the Falcon 9 first stage booster supporting this mission, SpaceX said. The booster has previously launched Dragon's first crew demonstration mission and now 10 Starlink missions.

29.title: Drug addict steals valuables from Delhi railway station waiting room, held
29.article_body: A drug addict who used to steal passengers' valuables from the waiting rooms of Old Delhi Railway Station has been arrested by the police. "He is a drug addict and in order to fulfil his drug requirements, he commits crime like theft," the police said. The incident came to light when one passenger found her bag missing.

30.title: Kajol to make web series debut, says 'Love to take challenges head-on'
30.article_body: Kajol is set to make her web series debut with an upcoming project. Speaking about it, she said, "Exploring new formats is always a challenge; but...I love to take challenges head-on." "Being an avid fan of digital series...the concept has always been intriguing," she added. Kajol was last seen in the film 'Tribhanga', which premiered on an OTT platform.

31.title: 2 cases of Omicron sub-variant BA.2.75 detected in Singapore
31.article_body: Two individuals with a travel history to India have tested positive for Omicron sub-variant BA.2.75, nicknamed Centaurus, in Singapore, local media reported citing the country's health ministry. The ministry said that the two individuals had isolated themselves immediately after testing positive for COVID-19. It added that the patients have made a full recovery since then.

32.title: Want President who looks into misuse of constitutional institutions: Tejashwi
32.article_body: As voting for Presidential poll is underway, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Monday said there is a "threat" to democracy. "In this country, there's a state of anarchy…The misuse of constitutional institutions is rampant. We would want a President who looks into it," he added. "Our PM doesn't even discuss the issues facing the youth or the farmers," he stated.

33.title: Batra quits as IOA President, FIH Chief, IOC member; pics of resignation letters surface
33.article_body: Narinder Batra has stepped down as the Indian Olympic Association (IOA) President, International Olympic Committee (IOC) member and International Hockey Federation (FIH) Chief due to personal reasons. Pictures of his three resignation letters all dated July 18, 2022 have surfaced online. In June, the Delhi High Court had ordered Batra to stop functioning as IOA President in a contempt proceeding.

34.title: Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation's half resources have come from Warren: Bill Gates
34.article_body: In a blog, Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates said that though the foundation is named Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, "half of its resources to date have come from Warren Buffett's gifts". Gates wrote, "Since 2006, Warren has gifted the foundation $35.7 billion, including his most recent gift of $3.1 billion in June."

35.title: 8-yr-old Aditya Patil wins Dance Deewane Juniors, says 'Will buy a big house'
35.article_body: Aditya Patil has won the first season of the talent reality show 'Dance Deewane Juniors'. The eight-year-old, who is from Gujarat's Surat, was awarded the trophy and ₹20 lakh cash prize. Talking about how he wants to spend the prize money, Aditya told ETimes, "I will give the winning amount to my grandfather and we will buy a big house."

36.title: This GST rate hike is breathtakingly irresponsible: Shashi Tharoor
36.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has criticised the BJP-led Centre for the new hiked GST rates implemented from Monday. "This GST rate hike is breathtakingly irresponsible at a time of mounting economic difficulties for most Indians," Tharoor said. "The common citizen will bear the brunt of the burden even as inflation eats into his earnings," he added.

37.title: 99 killed in recent gang violence in Haiti's Cite Soleil: UN
37.article_body: The United Nations (UN) human rights office has said 99 people were killed recently amid fighting between rival gangs in the Cite Soleil area in Haiti's capital Port-au-Prince. It added that it's "deeply concerned by worsening violence" in Port-au-Prince. A UN human rights body's spokesperson said that 934 killings have been documented across the capital from January to June end.

38.title: Pant did what Jos Buttler couldn't do for England: Ojha
38.article_body: Former India cricketer Pragyan Ojha has said India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant challenged himself "mentally" in his unbeaten 125-run innings in the third ODI against England. "Pant has maturity and temperament. He has already displayed the qualities in Test cricket. [And now], he [has] shown the same in one-day cricket...He did what Jos Buttler couldn't do for England," stated Ojha.

39.title: RBI is of the view that cryptocurrencies should be prohibited: FM Sitharaman
39.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has recommended to the government that it should frame regulations for cryptocurrencies and is of the view that they should be prohibited, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said. Citing the borderless nature of cryptocurrencies, she further said that any legislation for regulation or for banning can be effective only after significant international collaboration.

40.title: Very heavy rainfall warning in several states; IMD releases list
40.article_body: The IMD has predicted isolated very heavy rainfall in Himachal Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Maharashtra, Uttarakhand, east Rajasthan and west Madhya Pradesh between July 18 and 20. Meanwhile, isolated very heavy rainfall is also likely over Arunachal Pradesh, Assam and Meghalaya from July 18 to 21. IMD warned about localised flooding of roads and waterlogging in low lying areas.

41.title: Gabbar Singh strikes again: Rahul criticises Centre over GST rates hike
41.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi criticised the Centre over the latest increase in GST rates by comparing the rates of various commodities before and after the hike through a picture shared by him on Twitter. "Gabbar Singh [GST] strikes again," Rahul tweeted. He added, "BJP [shows their] masterclass on how to destroy what was once one of the world's fastest-growing economies."

42.title: Excited to announce my next film starring Kartik Aaryan: Kabir Khan
42.article_body: Filmmaker Kabir Khan took to Instagram to announce his upcoming project with actor Kartik Aaryan. "I'm excited to announce my next project starring Kartik in a never before seen avatar," he wrote on Instagram. Kabir added the project will be based on a "fascinating true story". "We start shooting early next year," he further added.

43.title: Shiv Sena doesn't see Prez polls as any political election: Aaditya
43.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray said that his party believes that Presidential polls are different from any political election. Stating that the party is supporting Droupadi Murmu in the ongoing Presidential polls, he added, "It's the highest post and votes should be cast for a suitable candidate." Earlier, he had said that Murmu is a tribal and we support tribals.

44.title: Kallakurichi student's father suspects murder, Madras HC orders fresh autopsy
44.article_body: Madras High Court has ordered a fresh autopsy of the Class 12 girl student, who allegedly died by suicide, after the victim's father moved the court, seeking a second post-mortem examination, suspecting it to be a murder. Reports said that the post-mortem report stated that the victim appeared to have died of haemorrhage and shock due to multiple injuries.

45.title: 82-yr-old Pune man robbed of ₹19,000 he had collected for Haj pilgrimage
45.article_body: An 82-year-old man was robbed of ₹19,000, which he had collected as donations for his Haj pilgrimage, by a fraudster on the pretext of doubling the amount near a mosque in Bhavani Peth, Pune. The accused tricked the victim by diverting his attention before fleeing from the spot, police said. Notably, the victim worked as a daily wage labourer.

46.title: 12 people killed in flash floods in China; thousands evacuated
46.article_body: At least 12 people were killed and 12 others are missing after flash floods hit northwest and southwest China, state media reported on Sunday. While at least six people were reported dead in Sichuan, the remaining were recorded in Gansu. Thousands of people have also been evacuated. This comes as parts of the country are facing a heat wave.

47.title: Kallakurichi student death case transferred to CBCID, 3 school officials arrested
47.article_body: The investigation related to the death of a 17-year-old student in Tamil Nadu's Kallakurichi has been transferred to the CBCID, Tamil Nadu DGP announced. The police have also arrested three persons, including the correspondent, secretary and the principal of the ECR Sakthi International school, reports said. Violent protests had also taken place in front of the school.

48.title: Plea to stop SpiceJet's operations amid recent mishaps dismissed by Delhi HC
48.article_body: The Delhi High Court dismissed a plea seeking to stop the operations of SpiceJet over recent technical snags. The plea cited several incidents involving SpiceJet flights and claimed that passengers' lives are at risk due to their improper management. The DGCA has taken note of incidents involving SpiceJet flights and is free to proceed on its own, the court noted.

49.title: Elect me to save democracy: Yashwant Sinha on Presidential poll
49.article_body: As the voting for the Presidential election is underway, Opposition candidate Yashwant Sinha on Monday said that this poll is important and will set a path for the country’s democracy. "I appeal to all voters to listen to their hearts. This is a secret ballot, I hope they'll use their discretion and elect me to save democracy," Sinha added.

50.title: Had no money, cried myself to sleep: Monica Chauudhary on struggling days
50.article_body: Actress Monica Chauudhary, known for shows like 'Apharan' and 'Salt City', spoke about her struggling days in Mumbai and said that she sometimes had no money for food. "On those nights, I have cried myself to sleep, thinking that I should go back," she added. Monica further said she was "kicked out of" many shows and films.

51.title: Was literally a father figure to Arjun Kapoor when he was young: Sanjay
51.article_body: Actor Sanjay Kapoor, opening up about his relationship with nephew and actor Arjun Kapoor, has said, "I have literally brought him up." He added, "Arjun and I have spent the most amount of time together. It may not seem like that right now, but when Arjun was very young, I was literally a father figure to him."

52.title: It's outstanding how Pant comes up with series-changing knocks: Jaffer
52.article_body: Praising India wicketkeeper-batter for his unbeaten 125-run innings in the final ODI against England, Wasim Jaffer said it's outstanding how the 24-year-old comes up with "series-changing" knocks. "Pant is in brilliant form and has already played some incredible knocks in his short career," he added. Pant had scored a century and a fifty in the one-off Test against England.

53.title: Prez should be able to guide govt on economy: Akhilesh on supporting Yashwant
53.article_body: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav said that he will cast vote for Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha today. "There should be someone in the country who can tell the government the situation of the economy, from time to time. Look at Sri Lanka's condition. So, there should be President who can say that from time to time," he said.

54.title: Tiger attacks 2 bike-borne men near Corbett in Almora, drags 1 in forest
54.article_body: A tiger attacked two bike-borne men and dragged one of them into nearby forest near the Corbett Tiger Reserve in Uttarakhand’s Almora, forest officials said. The incident occurred on Saturday night. “A tiger hiding in the bushes attacked them,” an official said. “So far, the teams have not been able to locate the man or the tiger,” said another official.

55.title: Delhi-NCR rains to intensify, forecast expected after assessment: IMD
55.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) has said that rainfall will intensify in Delhi-NCR on Tuesday or Wednesday. "By Monday, we will know better how much moisture is expected to come towards the region and based on that, a forecast on the intensity of rains expected can be made," an IMD scientist said on the development.

56.title: Woman who protested against war on Russian TV allegedly detained
56.article_body: Marina Ovsyannikova, a Russian woman who protested against Ukraine war on state TV in March, was allegedly detained briefly in Moscow on Sunday, according to her social media posts. Ovsyannikova shared pictures of the incident and claimed that she was going to walk her dogs when "people in uniform" approached her. Later, she stated on Facebook that she'd returned home.

57.title: 12 people dead as bus heading to Pune falls into Narmada River in MP
57.article_body: At least 12 people have died after a Maharashtra Roadways bus going from Indore to Pune fell into Narmada River in Madhya Pradesh's Dhar district, Madhya Pradesh Minister Narottam Mishra said. As many as 15 people have been rescued, the minister added. The bus was carrying around 50-60 passengers, according to reports.

58.title: Sunak praises father-in-law Narayana Murthy, says 'His firm employs thousands in UK'
58.article_body: One of the frontrunners for the UK PM's post, Rishi Sunak, said he is proud of what his parents-in-law built. Speaking about Infosys Founder NR Narayana Murthy, Sunak said, "My father-in-law came from...nothing and just had a dream and a couple of hundred pounds [from my] mother-in-law's savings…He...built one of the world's largest...companies that...employs thousands of people...in the UK."

59.title: Pic of Shah Rukh Khan shooting for 'Dunki' in London goes viral
59.article_body: A picture of actor Shah Rukh Khan from the sets of Rajkumar Hirani's 'Dunki' in London has gone viral on social media. He was spotted shooting at London's Waterloo for 'Dunki'. The film also features actress Taapsee Pannu. 'Dunki' is set to be based on an illegal route called the 'Donkey Flight' used by Indians to immigrate to other countries.

60.title: After 13.5 yrs, ‘most wanted’ couple held for killing Panchkula man over money
60.article_body: "Most wanted" couple, Raju and his wife Shilpa, has been arrested for murdering a Panchkula financier 13.5 years ago and throwing his four-year-old alive son into a canal. Reports said that in 2009, financier Vinod Mittal had lent money to Raju and Shilpa for a salon. Problems surfaced when Mittal asked for his money back, following which he was stabbed.

61.title: Google removes 8 apps infected with new 'Autolycos' malware from Play Store
61.article_body: Google has removed eight apps infected with a new Android malware named 'Autolycos' from Play Store. According to Bleeping Computer, the malware executes URLs on a remote browser and then includes the result in HTTP requests. The removed apps include Vlog Star Video Editor, Creative 3D Launcher, Wow Beauty Camera, Funny Camera, Razer Keyboard & Theme, and Gif Emoji Keyboard.

62.title: What goods & services get cheaper as new GST rates come into effect today?
62.article_body: Electric vehicles, whether or not fitted with a battery pack, will be eligible for the concessional GST rate of 5% from July 18. GST on renting trucks, and goods carriages (where the cost of fuel is included) will be cut to 12% from 18%. GST on ostomy appliances and orthopaedic equipment like splints will be reduced from 12% to 5%.

63.title: Working with Salman Khan in 'Kabhi...' is big opportunity: Siddharth
63.article_body: Speaking about working with Salman Khan in 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali', Siddharth Nigam has said, "Sharing screen space with Salman...is a big opportunity...it's a special moment for me." "I'm...fortunate that I got this offer...I hope it works out well," he added. Siddharth and Jassie Gill joined the project after Aayush Sharma and Zaheer Iqbal reportedly walked out from the movie.

64.title: Mom used to visit Tirupati temple on her b'day, stopped after marriage: Janhvi
64.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor has revealed that her late actress-mother Sridevi used to visit the Tirupati temple on her birthday every year but stopped after her marriage. "An inner voice told me to visit the temple on her birthday and I started going there on her birthdays. Now, the new year has also been added to that list," she added.

65.title: PTI leader displays weapons on visit to polling stations in Pak; held
65.article_body:
Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) leader Shahbaz Gill was arrested on Sunday from Muzaffargarh 
after he allegedly carried and displayed weapons on his visit to polling stations amid by-elections in Pakistan's Punjab. Following the arrest, PTI leaders criticised the move claiming it was an attempt to "rig the elections". A police official told Dawn that Gill was taken to an undisclosed location.

66.title: Kylie Jenner, Travis criticised for 'flaunting private jets' after hug pic goes viral
66.article_body: Kylie Jenner is facing criticism after posting a black-and-white photo of her, Travis Scott and their daughter Stormi Webster hugging each other while standing in between two private planes on a tarmac. "You wanna take mine or yours," Kylie wrote. Social media users accused them of "flaunting" their private jets, with one saying, "Maybe take neither and reduce...carbon footprint."

67.title: It was one of those series where top order didn't come to the party: Rohit
67.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma, on being asked whether he's worried about top-order batters, said the top-order, including himself, got out to poor shots in the third England ODI. He added, "I still back those guys (Virat and Dhawan) to come out good." Rohit further said, "[It was] one of those series where the top order didn't come to the party."

68.title: Rishabh Pant's fearless mentality sets him apart: Jos Buttler
68.article_body: England white-ball captain Jos Buttler said there are many "stroke players" in the world but India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant is a "fearless player". Buttler added, "Pant is great for the game in all the formats...It's probably his mentality that sets him apart." The 24-year-old scored his maiden ODI hundred on Sunday to help India win three-match series against England.

69.title: Ranthambore tigers move closer to human habitats as their population rises
69.article_body: The population of tigers in Rajasthan's Ranthambore Tiger Reserve (RTR) has seen a 45% growth in last eight years due to which several tigers are moving out and posing danger to nearby human habitats, officials said. The reserve had 59 tigers in 2014 and now it has 86 living in an area of 1,334 square km, according to official data.

70.title: Saudi Arabia doubled Russian oil imports in Q2, freeing up own oil for exports: Report
70.article_body: The world's largest oil exporter, Saudi Arabia, more than doubled its Russian oil imports in the second quarter, enabling it to free up its own crude for export, as per data accessed by Reuters. It imported 6,47,000 tonnes of Russian oil from April to June. Russia has been selling fuel at discounted prices amid Western sanctions over the Ukraine war.

71.title: Hyd authority's one-time scheme offers 90% waiver on property tax arrears
71.article_body: The Telangana government has announced a one-time scheme (OTS) for clearing pending property tax arrears within Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) limits and all other urban local bodies. The scheme will allow a waiver of 90% on interest payment, provided that the principal amount plus 10% of interest on accumulated arrears is paid in one go for financial year 2021-22.

72.title: PM Modi casts his vote to elect the President; pic surfaces
72.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has cast his vote as the election to elect the new President of India began on Monday. Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel, Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik, Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath and other MPs and MLAs also voted. NDA fielded Droupadi Murmu as their candidate, while the Opposition fielded Yashwant Sinha for the post.

73.title: There should be dialogue in Parliament with open mind: PM Modi
73.article_body: Ahead of monsoon session, PM Narendra Modi on Monday said there should be a dialogue in Parliament with an open mind. "If necessary, there should be debate. I urge all MPs to contemplate deeply and discuss," PM Modi added. "This session is also important because elections for office of President and Vice President are taking place right now," he stated.

74.title: Milkman dies after being hit by speeding car in Navi Mumbai
74.article_body: A milkman died after being thrown off the road along with his scooter by a speeding car at Palm Beach Road, Navi Mumbai. The incident happened when the deceased, Manoj Kumar (27), was returning home from NRI Estate on Sunday. Meanwhile, the car driver, Akshay Surve (25), crashed into a road divider and landed on the opposite side, police said.

75.title: Swiggy delivery boy riding motorcycle helps Zomato delivery boy on cycle, clip goes viral
75.article_body: A video of a Swiggy delivery boy on a motorcycle helping a Zomato delivery boy who was riding a bicycle in Delhi is going viral on social media. The video shows the Swiggy agent holding his hand so that the Zomato agent wouldn't have to pedal. "Divided by work and united by humanity," a social media user reacted.

76.title: Tell them Queen: Priyanka to Sushmita on reacting to 'gold digger' remark
76.article_body: Reacting to being called a gold digger, Sushmita Sen penned a note on Instagram and wrote, "I always (famously) preferred diamonds! And yes, I still buy them myself!" Several celebrities reacted to Sushmita's post. Actress Priyanka Chopra commented, "Tell em, Queen!" Other celebrities like Ranveer Singh, Neha Dhupia and Suniel Shetty also reacted to Sushmita's post.

77.title: My wife said, 'It's too much': Chris on his 'Love & Thunder' physique
77.article_body: Actor Chris Hemsworth has revealed his wife Elsa Pataky's reaction to his bulky physique in 'Thor: Love and Thunder'. "My wife was like, 'Bleh, it's too much'," he stated. Chris further added, "There are a lot of my male friends who are like, 'Yeah!' but a lot of female friends and family are like, 'Yuck'." Taika Waititi directed the film.

78.title: Man gets Chandigarh hotel's number online to book room, loses ₹28,000
78.article_body: A man, who wanted to book a room in one of the hotels in Chandigarh, ended up losing ₹28,000 to a fraudster after he dialled the number he got from the internet. He said he was asked to share an OTP once he called on the number. Upon sharing the OTP, ₹28,000 were debited from his account in two transactions.

79.title: Stats say Murmu will become 1st tribal woman President of India: BJP MLA
79.article_body: BJP MLA from Darjeeling, Neeraj Tamang Zimba, on Monday said that according to the statistics, NDA candidate Droupadi Murmu will become the first tribal woman President of the country. "This (Presidential poll) is just a formality. She has already won…It's a joyous occasion. There's support from everywhere. It is historic," Zimba added before voting began for the Presidential election.

80.title: 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign aims to take patriotism into hearts of people: Shah
80.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday interacted with CMs of all states/UTs to discuss the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign under the Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav, an official statement said. "It’s a programme to take the spirit of patriotism to the highest level into the hearts and minds of the people," Shah said.

81.title: Brewpub in Germany offers beer for sunflower oil amid shortages
81.article_body: A brewpub in Germany's Munich is offering its customers a litre of beer in exchange for the same quantity of sunflower oil amid shortages due to the Russia-Ukraine war. "The whole thing came up because we simply ran out of oil in the kitchen," the brewpub's manager told Reuters TV. The brewpub's manager said that getting oil is "very difficult".

82.title: Voting to elect the President of India begins
82.article_body: The voting for the Presidential election began on Monday, with MPs and MLAs across the country casting their votes. NDA has nominated Droupadi Murmu as their candidate while the Opposition fielded Yashwant Sinha as their candidate for the post. Earlier, Shiv Sena's faction led by Uddhav Thackeray expressed support for Murmu, while AAP said it would support Sinha.

83.title: Ukrainian Prez Zelenskyy fires security chief, Prosecutor General
83.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has dismissed the nation's Security Service Head and the Prosecutor General, citing hundreds of cases of treason and collaboration with Russia within their departments. "In particular, more than 60 employees of the prosecutor's office and...Security Service of Ukraine remained in...[Russia-occupied territory] and are working against our state," he said.

84.title: Used to work on 5 films together, focus is on 1 project today: Sanjay Kapoor
84.article_body: Actor Sanjay Kapoor has said that he earlier used to work on five films together. "Today, we maintain focus on a single project and that's the reason why the quality has really improved when it comes to performances, continuity, and many different aspects of filmmaking," he added. "One remains in character for a longer time," Sanjay further said.

85.title: Shanaya has been training for 8-9 yrs to become an actress: Sanjay
85.article_body: Actor Sanjay Kapoor has said that his daughter Shanaya Kapoor has been training for 8-9 years to become an actress. "This is a wonderful industry to work in and it was Shanaya's decision to be an actor...She was always attending her dance classes, diction training and what not," he added. Shanaya is yet to make her Bollywood debut.

86.title: Video shows iPhone lodged with a bullet after it saves Ukrainian soldier's life
86.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media purportedly showing an iPhone 11 Pro stuck with a bullet after it saved a Ukrainian soldier's life. The clip shows the damaged iPhone being taken out of the soldier's backpack after the shot was fired. The bullet couldn't penetrate the iPhone through the backpack, creating a clear bulge and shattering its screen.

87.title: 27-yr-old American woman fakes kidnapping in Delhi to get money from parents
87.article_body: A 27-year-old US citizen staying in Delhi allegedly faked her abduction after running out of money in an attempt to extort cash from her parents, police said. In an email to her parents, she said she was in an unsafe environment and being assaulted. Police found her staying with a Nigerian man she befriended in Greater Noida.

88.title: Told my captain even if I go for sixes, I'll try the short balls: Hardik
88.article_body: All-rounder Hardik Pandya said he used the short balls in the third ODI against England as the wicket was not ideal to bowl full. "Told my captain even if I go for sixes...[I'll try short balls because] if I take a wicket, it'll make a difference," added Hardik. "In ODIs, [batters] have to take on the short ball," he stated.

89.title: Acting in Hindi is a little out of my comfort zone for now: Allu Arjun
89.article_body: 'Pushpa' actor Allu Arjun in an interview said, "Acting in Hindi is a little out of my comfort zone for now, but once there's a requirement, I'll go all-out." Earlier, he stated that he does not wish to play a 'second role' in Hindi movies. Allu Arjun is currently working on 'Pushpa: The Rule', the sequel to 'Pushpa: The Rise'.

90.title: No option other than dialogue with Pak to resolve Kashmir issue: Mufti
90.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti said that there is no option other than holding dialogue with Pakistan and other stakeholders to resolve the Kashmir issue and stop the bloodshed. Her statement came after a CRPF officer was killed by militants in Pulwama on Sunday. She further said that her party always believed that bullets or grenades cannot solve an issue.

91.title: New Zealand inflation surges to 7.3%, highest since 1990
91.article_body: Inflation in New Zealand has surged at its fastest pace in over three decades. As per official data, the Consumer Price Index increased 7.3% in the second quarter, up from 6.9% in the first quarter and the fastest since the June quarter of 1990 when prices rose 7.6%. Economists had predicted that inflation would come in at 7% or 7.1%.

92.title: SEBI clears appointment of BSE chief Ashish Chauhan as new NSE CEO & MD
92.article_body: The Securities and Exchange Board of India has approved the appointment of Ashish Kumar Chauhan as the new MD and CEO of the NSE. Chauhan is currently the MD and CEO of the BSE and will replace Vikram Limaye whose term ended as NSE chief on July 16. The appointment is subject to Chauhan accepting the offer.

93.title: India reports 16,935 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,44,264
93.article_body: India has reported 16,935 COVID-19 cases and 51 related deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 20,528 COVID-19 cases. The number of active coronavirus cases in India stand at 1,44,264, according to the latest data.

94.title: Pune jewellery store to give 'commitment rings' to 7,500 soldiers
94.article_body: A Pune jewellery store has launched 'EkIndia Mission' to mark 75 years of independence. As part of the mission, 7,500 soldiers will be given 'commitment rings'. These rings would be made of silver, gold, diamond, and soil from different states. "The ring is made of silver with 'Bharat' written on it," Sanket B Biyani, one of partners of store said.

95.title: Delhi's NSD to get a new building; work may start in 6 months
95.article_body: The National School of Drama in Delhi is all set to get a new building for which the construction work is likely to begin in six months. "The design for the new building will be finalised by July-end," an official said. Despite ₹180 crore being sanctioned in 2016 for the revamp, the work got delayed due to multiple reasons.

96.title: 'I am in, when do I start?' Ryan Gosling on working in Indian films
96.article_body: Hollywood actor Ryan Gosling, during an interview, was asked if he wanted to feature in an Indian film. To this, the actor replied, "I would love that. I really would. If you can hook me up, let me know. I am in, when do I start?" Actor Dhanush will be seen alongside Ryan and Chris Evans in 'The Gray Man'.

97.title: I saw Highway & was like 'she turned out to be like Big B': Ranbir on Alia
97.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor said that when he saw wife Alia Bhatt's movie 'Highway', he thought that she turned out to be like actor Amitabh Bachchan. "When I saw Highway and all, I came to Ayan's house only...But if I say such nice things about my wife now, then people won't take it seriously," he added.

98.title: Original BJP isn't running Karnataka govt, says DK Shivakumar
98.article_body: Karnataka Congress leader DK Shivakumar on Sunday said it's a coalition government in state and it's not being run by those from the “original BJP”. "It’s a government of all party MLAs," he added. "There's fear in BJP that there are a lot of internal problems. That’s the reason their national leaders are repeatedly coming and holding discussions," Shivakumar stated.

99.title: It was easy to identify him: Mufti after her sister identifies Yasin as her kidnapper
99.article_body: After Rubaiya Sayeed, sister of PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti, identified Kashmiri separatist leader Yasin Malik as one of her kidnappers, Mufti said he had been in public domain and it was easy to identify him. "Rubaiya was called as witness to identify someone…32 years is long time, people forget a lot of things. She couldn't identify anyone else," Mufti added.

100.title: Bird found mid-air in cockpit of Air India Express' Bahrain-Kochi flight
100.article_body: An alive bird was found in the cockpit of the Air India Express' Bahrain-Kochi flight on July 15 while it was mid-air. The bird was discovered in the glove box on the co-pilot's side of the aircraft when it was at a height of 37,000 feet. While the flight landed safely in Kochi, the DGCA is investigating the incident.

101.title: Class 10 student scared of exam result tweets to Mumbai Police, gets response
101.article_body: Ahead of the ICSE Class 10 board results declaration, a Maharashtra-based student took to Twitter and tagged Mumbai and Maharashtra Police saying, "Today is my ICSE results and I am really scared." Responding to his tweet, the Mumbai Police said, "Don't worry about your results. Exam is a journey. It is not just a final destination or an achievement."

102.title: I knew I had to step up: Hardik on his 4/24 in 3rd ODI against England
102.article_body: Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya said he knew he had to "step up" with the ball in the final ODI against England after Jasprit Bumrah was ruled out of the game. "I was told I might...bowl in death overs and those are big shoes to fill...I knew I had to step up," he stated. Hardik registered bowling figures of 7-3-24-4.

103.title: Hero Vired’s Management program offers campus immersion at INSEAD France
103.article_body: Hero Vired and INSEAD, the world's leading management institute, have jointly designed a 6-month online program on Strategic Management & Business Essentials which includes a 5-day on-campus immersion in France where students can attend live lectures by the INSEAD faculty. The program caters to professionals, entrepreneurs, & senior leaders looking to upgrade their leadership skills, it stated

104.title: 'Job mela' with over 70 companies to be held in Hyderabad on July 27
104.article_body: A 'job mela' will be organised in Hyderabad's Nampally by an organisation called Deccan blasters on July 27 from 9 am to 2 pm. Over 70 companies will take part in this 'mela' to fill up over 5,000 vacancies. "So far, we have conducted 24 job melas...and more than 4,000 candidates were selected," Deccans Blaster's chairman said.

105.title: Gunman opens fire inside US mall killing 3 people; civilian shoots him dead
105.article_body: Three people were killed and another two were injured at Greenwood Park Mall in the US state of Indiana after a man with a rifle opened fire in a food court, officials said. An armed civilian killed the man, Greenwood Police Department Chief said. Police have confiscated a suspicious backpack that was in a bathroom near the food court.

106.title: Rishabh Pant gifts his Man of the Match champagne to Ravi Shastri, video goes viral
106.article_body: India wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant gifted his Man of the Match champagne to ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri after India defeated England in the ODI series decider on Sunday. A video has gone viral showing Pant going towards Shastri and handing him the bottle, with crowd cheering in the background. Pant scored 125*(113) to win the Man of the Match award.

107.title: R Madhavan shares video of his son Vedaant breaking national junior record in swimming
107.article_body: Actor R Madhavan took to Twitter to share a video of his 16-year-old son Vedaant breaking the national junior record in 1,500m freestyle swimming in Boys Group 1 category. "Never say never," R Madhavan wrote alongside the video. "Nothing is as wonderful for a father as seeing his child's success," a Twitter user commented on Madhavan's post.

108.title: State of emergency declared by Sri Lanka's acting President
108.article_body: Acting Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe has declared a state of emergency in the country. "It is expedient, so to do, in the interests of public security, the protection of public order and the maintenance of supplies and services essential to the life of the community," the notice stated. Last week the emergency was declared after President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's escape.

109.title: Vedaant Madhavan, son of actor R Madhavan, breaks national junior swimming record
109.article_body: Maharashtra's 16-year-old swimmer Vedaant Madhavan, who's the son of actor R Madhavan, broke the national junior record in 1,500m freestyle in Boys Group 1 category. Vedaant clocked 16:01.73 at 48th Junior National Aquatic Championships 2022 to win gold medal and set the record. The previous record was held by Madhya Pradesh swimmer Advait Page, who had clocked 16:06.43 in 2017.

110.title: Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck get married in Las Vegas; pics released
110.article_body: Hollywood stars Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck got married in a late-night Las Vegas drive-through chapel. Jennifer announced their marriage in her newsletter with the heading "We did it". "Love is beautiful. Love is kind. And it turns out love is patient. Twenty years patient," she wrote in a message signed Jennifer Lynn Affleck.

111.title: We have the technical capability to build a nuclear bomb: Iran
111.article_body: Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei's senior advisor Kamal Kharrazi on Sunday told Al Jazeera that the country has the technical capability to build a nuclear bomb but has not decided whether to build one yet. This comes after US President Joe Biden pledged to stop Iran from "acquiring a nuclear weapon".

112.title: NATO's refusal to recognise Crimea as Russian is a threat: Medvedev
112.article_body: Deputy Chairman of the Russian Security Council Dmitry Medvedev on Sunday said that NATO and Ukraine's refusal to recognise Crimea as a part of Russia is a "systemic threat" to Russia. This comes a day after a Ukrainian official suggested that Crimea could come under bombardment by US-made HIMARS missiles deployed by Ukraine to counter Russian forces.

113.title: Jawans help woman deliver baby on river bank in Chhattisgarh
113.article_body: A tribal woman delivered a baby on a river bank with the help of Home Guard jawans in Chhattisgarh's rain-hit Bijapur district, police said. The woman needed to cross a river to reach the sub-health centre. However, she went into labour just before being shifted on the rescue boat and gave birth along the river with help from the jawans.

114.title: Scindia meets Aviation Ministry officials, DGCA over safety issues
114.article_body: Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia chaired a meeting with the ministry's senior officials and the regulator of the Directorate General of Civil Aviation, an official said. The meeting was held to discuss safety issues reported to the ministry in the last few weeks. Scindia told the officials that the safety of passengers is paramount and to ensure it's not compromised.

115.title: BigBasket's losses jumps four times in FY22 as employee costs soar
115.article_body: According to its latest filings with the Ministry of Corporate Affairs, BigBasket's Business to Consumer (B2C) arm reported that its net loss widened fourfold to ₹812.7 crore in FY22 from ₹202.7 crore in FY21. The Tata Digital-owned firm's employee expenses increased to ₹739 crore from ₹236 crore in FY21. The company's other expenditures such as advertising and transportation also doubled.

116.title: Police bust illegal casino in Meerut, arrest 43
116.article_body: In Meerut's Partapur area, 43 people were arrested after an illegal casino was busted, the police said. The police conducted a raid at the Octri Marriage Home on the basis of a tip-off and also seized ₹6 lakh in cash, Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) Rohit Singh Sajwan said. Those arrested are being produced in court, he added.

117.title: French public figures accuse new minister of homophobic comments
117.article_body: Over 100 French figures have signed open letter denouncing minister Caroline Cayeux for making homophobic remarks. Cayeux, who was appointed minister for territorial cohesion as part of France's new government on July 4, had termed France's plans to legalise gay marriage in 2013 as a "caprice" that goes "against nature". While she initially defended those remarks, she has since apologised.

118.title: Thank MP residents for reposing trust in BJP: PM on civic poll results
118.article_body: Congratulating winners of civic polls in MP, PM Narendra Modi on Sunday thanked the state's residents for "reposing their trust in BJP". "This victory is a symbol of the unwavering faith of the people in CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan's government," PM tweeted. BJP has won 7 mayoral seats, Congress has won 3 mayoral seats and AAP has bagged 1 seat.

119.title: Iran sanctions 61 US citizens for backing dissident group
119.article_body: Iran has imposed sanctions against 61 US citizens for extending support to an exiled dissident group Mujahideen-e-Khalq, Tehran announced on Saturday. According to Iranian state media, the sanctioned individuals include former US President Donald Trump's personal attorney Rudy Giuliani, former US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo and former White House National Security Adviser John Bolton.

120.title: Noodle-like object spotted on Mars, NASA releases pic
120.article_body: NASA's Perseverance rover spotted a string-like material that resembles a swirl of noodles. Sharing a picture, NASA said that the rover acquired the image of the area in front of it using its onboard Front Right Hazard Avoidance Camera A. The exact nature of the object is not known yet, with experts estimating that it could be debris.

121.title: 19-yr-old climbs electric tower as 15-yr-old girlfriend refuses to marry him in TN
121.article_body: A 19-year-old in Chennai climbed a high-tension electric tower, triggering a power cut in the area and affecting suburban train services there. The youth climbed the tower after his 15-year-old girlfriend refused to marry him. The girl had to be brought to the spot to convince him to climb down after the police, fire department and rescue team failed.

122.title: Remember no freebies to big producers, people watch you not them: Lalit Modi to Ranveer
122.article_body: Ex-IPL Chairman Lalit Modi took to Twitter to share a news article about Ranveer Singh's reaction to his and Sushmita's dating news. Lalit wrote, "Thank you for your kind wishes." He added, "I'm sorry no IPL now...But as I said take...time out and do what you desire...Remember (laughing and cash emojis) no freebies to big producers...People watch you not them."

123.title: I competed vs 3 of the greatest players: Hewitt on Federer, Nadal, Djokovic
123.article_body: After being inducted into the International Tennis Hall of Fame on Sunday, a ceremony delayed from 2021 by COVID-19, ex-world number one Lleyton Hewitt said he feels fortunate to have played across different generations. He added that he competed against three of the greatest tennis players the sport has ever seen in Roger Federer, Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic.

124.title: Novak Djokovic likes Kevin Pietersen's social media post in support of Virat Kohli
124.article_body: Twenty one-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic reacted to ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen's social media post in support of Virat Kohli. Djokovic liked the post on Instagram wherein Pietersen urged Kohli to be proud, walk tall and enjoy life. "There's way more than just the bubble of cricket out there. You'll be back, @virat.kohli," Pietersen had written in the post.

125.title: Supreme Court bench headed by CJI to hear pleas on Maha crisis on July 20
125.article_body: A Supreme Court bench headed by Chief Justice NV Ramana will on July 20 hear a batch of petitions related to the recent political crisis in Maharashtra. Both Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena and the faction led by CM Eknath Shinde have moved the court over the disqualification of MLAs. Meanwhile, Sanjay Raut demanded the imposition of President's rule in Maharashtra.

126.title: Dust storm causes massive 21-vehicle pileup in US; 2 children among 6 killed
126.article_body: A dust storm caused a pileup of 21 vehicles in US' Montana, killing six people, including two children. The storm reduced visibility to zero causing the "mass casualty crash" on the Interstate 90 highway near Hardin on Friday. Winds with speeds of around 60 mph were recorded around the time of the pile-up, reports said.

127.title: Tola wins men's marathon with championship record at World Athletics C'ships
127.article_body: Ethiopia's Tamirat Tola won a gold medal in the men's marathon at World Athletics Championships with a championship record on Sunday. He won the race in two hours 05.36 minutes. Compatriot Mosinet Geremew won a second successive silver, clocking 2:06.44, while Belgium's Somalia-born Bashir Abdi won bronze with a timing of 2:06.48.

128.title: Corporate funding in global solar sector down 11%: Mercom Capital
128.article_body: Corporate funding in global solar sector has declined 11% to $12 billion in first half of 2022 against $13.5 billion in the same period last year, a Mercom Capital report stated. In H1 2022, venture capital funding activity increased 125% to $3.7 billion across 53 deals. In the same time period, solar public market financing fell 10% to $3.3 billion.

129.title: Sri Lanka lowers fuel prices for the 1st time since Feb amid crisis
129.article_body: Sri Lanka on Sunday lowered its fuel prices for the first time since February of this year amid the country's ongoing economic crisis. Prices of petrol and diesel were lowered by LKR 20 each, which were previously priced at LKR 470/litre and LKR 460/litre respectively. Notably, the cash-strapped country has introduced a fuel rationing scheme this month.

130.title: Rishabh Pant smashes his 1st ever ODI hundred as India win series against England
130.article_body: Rishabh Pant smashed his first-ever hundred in ODI cricket as India defeated England by five wickets in the third ODI in Manchester to win the three-match series 2-1. Pant became the second designated Indian wicketkeeper after Rahul Dravid to smash an ODI hundred in England. India have now won eight consecutive international series under Rohit Sharma's captaincy.

131.title: Aiming to reduce Infant Mortality Rate in Karnataka: CM Bommai
131.article_body: Karnataka's Infant Mortality Rate (IMR) is 20 per 1000 live births and CM Basavaraj Bommai said that the aim is to reduce it to single digits. He also emphasised reducing the Maternal Mortality Rate (MMR). While IMR and MMR have reduced in the state, special focus is being given to 5-6 districts where the rate is high, he said.

132.title: Maharashtra reported 104 rain-related deaths since June 1
132.article_body: Maharashtra has reported 104 rain-related deaths since the onset of the monsoons on June 1, according to a report by the state disaster management authority. The fatalities have been recorded between June 1-July 16 with two deaths being reported in the last 24 hours. As per the report, rain-related incidents include floods, lightning strikes, landslides, collapse of structures, among others.

133.title: Guinea's military names acting PM during absence of Beavogui
133.article_body: Guinea's military junta appointed Commerce and Industry Minister Bernard Gomou to take over as acting PM in the absence of PM Mohamed Beavogui, state media reported on Saturday. No information regarding the period of the absence or the reason behind it was provided. Beavogui was appointed PM last October to oversee the transition to democracy, following a coup in September.

134.title: Afghan Interior Minister urges US to unfreeze country's $7bn funds
134.article_body: Afghanistan's acting Interior Minister Sirajuddin Haqqani has reportedly criticised the US for freezing Afghanistan's funds worth $7 billion and urged it to release the assets. Addressing a gathering in Khost province, Haqqani said that the formation of an inclusive government will automatically take place when "the western ideology" is eliminated from Afghanistan, local media reported.

135.title: UAE sentences lawyer, who represented Khashoggi, to 3 yrs in jail
135.article_body: The UAE has sentenced a US citizen and the former lawyer of slain Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi to three years in prison on charges of money laundering and tax evasion. The accused, Asim Ghafoor, has also been ordered to pay a fine of $816,748. The UAE termed Ghafoor's sentencing a coordinated move with the US to "combat transnational crimes".

136.title: Pak to get $4 bn from friendly countries amid forex crisis: Minister
136.article_body: Pakistan will likely receive $4 billion from friendly countries this month to bridge gap in its forex reserves highlighted by the International Monetary Fund (IMF), Finance Minister Miftah Ismail said. The country will receive the amount in form of deposits and investments, he added. Ismail's comments come as IMF reached a staff-level agreement with Pakistan for disbursal of $1.17 billion.

137.title: Arrests will be made for seeking rights in new India: Rahul Gandhi
137.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday criticised the government over unemployment and action against protesting youths, saying "arrests will be made for seeking rights in new India". "Don't ask questions. Don't raise your voice. Don't protest peacefully," he said. By shattering the hopes of crores of families, this dictatorial government is destroying the future of the country, Gandhi added.

138.title: India moved from cooperative federalism to coercive unilateralism: Sibal
138.article_body: Rajya Sabha MP and former Congress leader Kapil Sibal said that the country has "moved from cooperative federalism to coercive unilateralism". He further added that the politics of the central government is ruling every state instead of the Constitution. Addressing a federalism seminar, Sibal said BJP-led Centre's motive is to create 'opposition-mukt Bharat' (opposition-free India).

139.title: Tribal council in Pak prohibits women from visiting tourist spots
139.article_body: An all-male tribal council in Pakistan's Bajaur tribal district on Saturday issued a diktat barring women from visiting tourist spots, saying that the practice is "unethical" and against Islamic principles. The council further warned the government that failure to enforce the ban by Sunday would prompt the council members to take matters into their own hands, local media reported.

140.title: ED's conviction rate 0.5%, only used to target Opp'n: AAP MP
140.article_body: AAP Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh on Sunday accused the Central government of misusing the investigative agencies for targeting Opposition leaders in the country, adding that the conviction rate of ED is only 0.5%. He also alleged that the Punjab government is being forced to buy Adani coal at ₹30,000, which is ten times more than India coal.

141.title: Private schools in Tamil Nadu to remain closed tomorrow over Kallakurichi violence
141.article_body: The Tamil Nadu Private School Association president said all private nursery, matriculation and CBSE schools in the state will remain closed on Monday to protest against the attack on a school in Kallakurichi, where a girl died by suicide. Meanwhile, the Directorate of Matriculation said there's no prior permission for a strike. People protesting over the incident torched school buses.

142.title: 32 bills indicated by various departments for Monsoon session, 14 ready: Govt
142.article_body: The government said that 32 bills have been indicated by various departments for presentation in the Monsoon session of Parliament of which 14 are ready. The Monsoon session will commence on July 18 and is scheduled to continue till August 12. Parliamentary Affairs Minister Pralhad Joshi said some of these bills have already been discussed by standing committees of Parliament.

143.title: 30-yr-old sexually assaults minor for 5 yrs in Raj, gets life term
143.article_body: A POCSO court in Rajasthan's Bundi on Saturday convicted a 30-year-old doctor to life imprisonment for sexually assaulting a minor girl for five years. A case was registered against the accused in 2018, said Special Public Prosecutor Rakesh Thakur. When the minor moved to Kota to study, the accused would also reach there and rape her, he said.

144.title: Worker seen carrying PM Modi, UP CM's photos in garbage cart fired; video surfaces
144.article_body: A contractual worker in UP's Mathura Nagar Nigam was fired after he carried pictures of PM Narendra Modi and CM Yogi Adityanath, among other dignitaries in his garbage cart. A video of him carrying the photos in the cart has also been widely shared online. In the video, the man said he simply found the pictures lying in the garbage.

145.title: 4-month-old baby boy dies after being thrown off roof of a 3-storey house in UP
145.article_body: A four-month-old baby boy died after being thrown off the roof of a three-storey house by a monkey in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly district, an official said. Bareilly Chief Conservator of Forests Lalit Verma said that the incident has been reported and a team of the forest department has been sent to conduct an investigation.

146.title: S Lanka in devastating state due to ill-advised steps: Oppn leader
146.article_body: Sri Lankan Opposition leader Sajith Premadasa said on Sunday that the country is in a "devastated state due" to "ill-advised economic steps". For three years, we have been telling the government to not proceed with such measures but they never listened, he added. Premadasa, along with three other leaders, will contest the upcoming Sri Lankan Presidential elections on July 20.

147.title: CFI organises conference in support of hijab in M'luru, hundreds attend
147.article_body: The Campus Front of India (CFI) organised a conference in support of students being allowed to wear hijab in Karnataka's Mangaluru on Saturday. The conference was attended by hundreds who also chanted slogans like 'Inquilab Zindabad' and 'Hijab is our right'. A skit was performed against Udupi BJP MLA Raghupathi Bhat for his statements against wearing hijab in educational institutes.

148.title: Stop SpiceJet operations: Plea in Delhi HC amid several malfunctions
148.article_body: A PIL has been filed in the Delhi High Court seeking direction to the Centre to stop the operation of SpiceJet Airlines in the wake of several incidents of technical glitches reported recently. The petitioner also sought direction to compensate the fair charges to passengers who have faced the threat to their life. The petition will be heard on Monday.

149.title: Bumrah wasn't there today but Hardik stepped in and how: Jaffer on 3rd ODI
149.article_body: After India bowled out England for 259 in 45.5 overs in third ODI at Old Trafford, Wasim Jaffer said, "Can't remember last time England were so tied down in a home series." He added, "Boom [Jasprit Bumrah] wasn't there today but Hardik Pandya stepped [in] and how." All-rounder Hardik posted 4/24 in seven overs, his best-ever bowling figures in ODIs.

150.title: I still haven't given up on US Open: Zverev on recovering after ankle surgery
150.article_body: World number two Alexander Zverev, who is undergoing rehab after having surgery on his right ankle, said he still hasn't given up on playing at US Open, beginning August 29. "And, of course, I want to be part of...Davis Cup for myself," he added. Zverev had twisted his ankle in French Open semi-final against Rafael Nadal on June 3.

151.title: INS Sindhudhvaj decommissioned after 35 years of service to nation
151.article_body: The Indian Navy decommissioned INS Sindhudhvaj on Saturday after serving the nation for 35 years. The ceremony was held at the Naval Dockyard in Visakhapatnam and was attended by 15 former commanding officers and 26 commissioning crew. Sindhudhvaj was the flag bearer of indigenisation and the Indian Navy's efforts towards achieving Atmanirbharta amid the Russian-built Sindhughosh-class submarines.

152.title: List shows fewest runs scored by Virat Kohli in bilateral series in ODI cricket
152.article_body: Virat Kohli on Sunday got out for 17 runs in the third ODI against England, aggregating 33 runs in the series. Kohli's fewest runs in a bilateral ODI series had come against Pakistan in 2012-2013, when he scored 13 runs in three innings. It is followed by 26 runs in three innings against West Indies earlier this year.

153.title: Which are the worst countries to move to as per latest global survey?
153.article_body: As per the latest Expat Insider ranking of 52 countries, Kuwait is considered the worst country for expats with New Zealand occupying the second-to-last spot. Hong Kong, Cyprus, Luxembourg, Japan, South Africa, Turkey, Italy and Malta have also been named among the least favoured countries by expats. Kuwait scored poorly in quality of life and ease of settling indices.

154.title: Impose Prez rule in Maharashtra till SC order on rebel MPs: Raut
154.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut has demanded the imposition of the President's rule in Maharashtra till the constitution bench of the Supreme Court gives its verdict on the plea seeking disqualification of rebel MLAs. "Maharashtra's 12-crore population has a cabinet of 2 members that is taking arbitrary decisions. Where is the regard for the constitution?" he tweeted.

155.title: SP politician's killer on run since 2005 arrested from MP
155.article_body: A key accused in the killing of a Samajwadi Party leader in UP's Kaushambi has been arrested from MP, after being on the run for nearly two decades, police officials said on Sunday. The accused kept changing his location from Bihar to Maharashtra before settling in MP, officials said. He had changed his identity, said DSP (Prayagraj STF) Navendu Kumar.

156.title: Road built 1 month ago caves in after rainfall in Ahmedabad, video surfaces
156.article_body: A road built nearly one month ago near Surabhi Park in Gujarat's Ahmedabad caved in after a couple of hours of rainfall on Sunday. A video of the incident that has surfaced on social media shows a big portion of the road getting washed away. Traffic along the route has been affected after the incident.

157.title: Hardik Pandya records his best-ever bowling figures in ODI cricket
157.article_body: Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya on Sunday recorded his best-ever bowling figures in ODI cricket. The 28-year-old registered bowling figures of 7-3-24-4 in the third ODI against England at Old Trafford in Manchester. Notably, Pandya's best bowling figures in Test cricket (6-1-28-5) and T20I cricket (4-0-33-4) had also come in England.

158.title: Virat Kohli gives tips to Siraj, he dismisses Root for duck next ball; video goes viral
158.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing fast bowler Mohammed Siraj dismissing England's Joe Root for a duck a ball after being given tips by Virat Kohli. Root got out for a three-ball duck. Earlier in that over, Siraj dismissed Jonny Bairstow for a three-ball duck. Siraj finished with figures of 9-1-66-2 in the innings.

159.title: We take measures whenever Chinese aircraft comes near LAC: IAF chief
159.article_body: Air Chief Marshal Vivek Ram Chaudhari has said that air activity across Line of Actual Control (LAC) is continuously monitored, adding that IAF takes "appropriate measures" whenever any Chinese aircraft is detected near LAC. His comments come as Chinese aircraft had reportedly breached LAC briefly last month. Notably, 16th high-level military talks between India and China were held on Sunday.

160.title: Latest ranking of world's top 10 countries for expats released
160.article_body: The Expat Insider Rankings for 2022 have been released with Mexico securing the top spot and Indonesia occupying the second position. Taiwan, Portugal, Spain, UAE, Vietnam, Thailand, Australia and Singapore are also among the top 10 countries to move to. India has been ranked 36 out of the 52 countries on the list, with a high affordability score.

161.title: Your attitude to win inspires everyone: Sachin on Sindhu's Singapore Open win
161.article_body: Taking to Twitter to congratulate PV Sindhu after she won the Singapore Open title, Sachin Tendulkar wrote, "Your [Sindhu's] attitude and spirit to win every game is something that inspires everyone!" He added, "Many more to follow." Sindhu defeated China's Wang Zhi Yi 21-9, 11-21, 21-15 in the final to clinch her third title of the year.

162.title: Always preferred diamonds, I still buy them myself: Sushmita on being called gold digger
162.article_body: Reacting to being called a gold digger for dating Lalit Modi, Sushmita Sen penned a post on Instagram. She wrote, "I dig deeper than gold...and I've always (famously) preferred diamonds! And yes I still buy them myself!" "It's heartbreaking to see just how miserable & unhappy the world around us is becoming," she wrote in the post.

163.title: India's Anjum Moudgil wins bronze in Changwon Shooting World Cup
163.article_body: India's Anjum Moudgil won a bronze medal in 50m Rifle 3 Positions Women at ISSF Shooting World Cup in Changwon, South Korea on Sunday. Anjum shot 402.9 in the final round to finish third. This is the 28-year-old's second straight individual World Cup medal of 2022. Anjum had won silver in the same event at Baku World Cup last month.

164.title: Bengaluru reports 6 murders, including that of 2 women, in 3 days
164.article_body: Bengaluru reported six murders, including that of two women, since Friday. In Anekal, a man allegedly killed his 25-year-old wife over suspected infidelity, police said, adding that he has been arrested. A 57-year-old woman was murdered when she was alone at home on Friday and jewellery and about ₹3 lakh in cash were also reported missing.

165.title: BJP wins 4 seats, AAP wins 1 in Madhya Pradesh mayoral polls
165.article_body: BJP has won mayoral seats in Burhanpur, Satna, Khandwa and Sagar, while AAP's Rani Agrawal has won the mayoral post in Singrauli in the party's civic poll debut in the state. Congress has won in Chhindwara. The elections in the first phase were held for 133 civic bodies, including 11 municipal corporations and 36 councils, on July 6.

166.title: The terms I have coined are now part of pop culture: Kangana
166.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut stated in an interview that her interviews, quotes and terms she has coined are now a part of pop culture. The actress added that she believes she knows the pulse of the audience. "I do believe that the audience is looking for something which will stimulate their intellectual side and not just their sensual side," she said.

167.title: CRPF personnel killed in terrorist attack in J&K's Pulwama
167.article_body: A CRPF officer was killed on Sunday afternoon after terrorists ambushed security forces deployed at a checkpoint in J&K's Pulwama, Kashmir Police said. According to police, ASI Vinod Kumar was rushed to a hospital where he succumbed to his injuries during treatment. The area has been cordoned off and a search operation is underway, police added.

168.title: 'Namma Clinics' to be launched in 243 B'luru wards from next month
168.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said on Sunday that 'Namma Clinics' will be launched in 243 wards of Bengaluru from next month onwards. The clinics will provide services for the detection of non-communicable diseases and referral for higher treatment to specialists, CM Bommai had earlier said. The clinics will reportedly each have a medical officer, a staff nurse and two assistants.

169.title: Quite a bit of my brain is missing: GoT actress Emilia on suffering 2 brain haemorrhages
169.article_body: Opening up about suffering two brain haemorrhages in 2011 and 2013, Game of Thrones (GoT) actress Emilia Clarke said, "There’s quite a bit [of my brain] missing!" She added, "The amount of my brain that is no longer usable...It’s remarkable that I am able to speak, sometimes articulately, and live my life completely normally with absolutely no repercussions."

170.title: Explosions heard for 2 hrs as plane with 12 tons of mines & weapons crashes in Greece
170.article_body: A plane carrying 12 tons of munitions including mines crashed in Greece on Saturday night, triggering explosions that were heard for two hours. All eight crew members of the plane, that was going from Serbia to Bangladesh, were killed. A fireball was also seen by local residents at the crash site that's being combed for remaining explosive cargo and chemicals.

171.title: Over 75 home buyers cheated of ₹15 cr by builder: Gurugram Police
171.article_body: Over 75 home buyers were allegedly cheated of ₹15 crore by a real estate firm on the assurance of providing flats, Gurugram Police said. Savyasachi Infrastructure Private Limited had taken money from the victims with the assurance that their flats would be ready within a year, but work is yet to begin even after four years, police said.

172.title: Over 50,000 challans issued in 4 months for improper parking in Delhi
172.article_body: As many as 545 vehicles were towed in Delhi in the last four months for improperly parking in bus lanes, Delhi Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot said. During this period, over 50,000 no-parking challans were issued against violators, while 1,810 challans were issued against bus drivers. Nearly 90% of buses now drive in their designated bus lanes, the ministry said.

173.title: 23-year-old shot man dead by his friend over argument in Delhi
173.article_body: A 23-year-old man was shot dead by his friend in Delhi's Azadpur on the intervening night of Saturday and Sunday following an argument, police said. The victim's body was found by patrol vehicles near the Ramleela Ground in Azadpur. He was taken to the Babu Jagjivan Ram Memorial Hospital where he was declared brought dead.

174.title: Funding in Indian startups dropped to $6 billion in April-June: Nasscom
174.article_body: According to industry body, Nasscom, funding in Indian startups dropped 17% to $6 billion in the April-June quarter. According to the quarterly investment factbook, in collaboration with PGA Labs, deals also dropped 17% due to dampened market sentiment while funding increased. With four new unicorns, the total number of unicorns in the first half of 2022 is now 20.

175.title: Master craftsman: Ian Bishop on Babar Azam's 7th Test ton in Galle
175.article_body: After Pakistan captain Babar Azam hit his seventh Test century in the side's first innings of first Test against Sri Lanka, Ian Bishop tweeted, "Master craftsman; Babar...superb once again."
