350.article_body: Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra on Saturday said the state government is investigating the PSI scam very seriously and added that the CID has been given complete freedom of investigation. "CID is not putting any pressure on Amrit Paul (arrested ADGP)," he said. Over 65 people have been arrested in the Karnataka PSI scam so far.

351.title: Dhankhar's experience will benefit nation: Shah on NDA's VP candidate
351.article_body: Reacting to Jagdeep Dhankhar's nomination as NDA's candidate for the Vice President of India's post, Union Home Minister Amit Shah tweeted, "His...long administrative experience in the constitutional process of the House will greatly benefit the country." "I am sure that with the election of Shri Dhankhar ji as Vice President...the dignity of our Upper House will increase further," he added.

352.title: 215 Indian athletes to take part in Commonwealth Games 2022, list released
352.article_body: The Indian Olympic Association on Saturday announced a 322-strong contingent including 215 athletes and 107 officials and support staff for the Commonwealth Games 2022. The Games are scheduled to be held in Birmingham from July 28 to August 8. Some prominent Indian athletes include include Neeraj Chopra, PV Sindhu, Mirabai Chanu, Lovlina Borgohain, Bajrang Punia and Ravi Kumar Dahiya.

353.title: European Commission sues Hungary over LGBTQ law
353.article_body: The European Commission is suing Hungary for limiting access to information on LGBTQ issues and for cancelling the licence of the country's last independent radio broadcaster. The developments at the European Court of Justice could see EU funds being frozen for Hungary. Presently, Hungary restricts information about LGBTQ from youngsters.

354.title: Fans chase MS Dhoni, take running selfies with him on London street; video goes viral
354.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing fans chasing MS Dhoni and taking running selfies with him on a street in London. In the video, fans can be seen keeping pace with security personnel surrounding Dhoni to get a glimpse of the former India captain. Dhoni was seen attending India's second ODI against England at Lord's.

355.title: Seoul celebrates its first pride parade in 3 years
355.article_body: Thousands of gay rights supporters marched in the Seoul Queer Parade on Saturday, which was held after a three-year gap due to the coronavirus pandemic. Participants carrying rainbow banners demanded an end to discrimination based on sexual orientation. The parade was held under police presence as nearby streets were filled with conservative Christians, protesting the "lewd" parade.

356.title: UK govt to hold emergency meet over high temperatures
356.article_body: The UK government will hold an emergency response meeting on Saturday to prepare for the record high temperatures the country is expecting in the coming days. British authorities on Friday issued their first ever "red" warning for heat conditions next week when temperatures could rise to 40°C. The highest temperature recorded in the UK was in 2019 at 38.7°C.

357.title: Tara Sutaria debuts as singer in 'Ek Villain Returns' song 'Shaamat'
357.article_body: Actress Tara Sutaria has debuted as a singer in Bollywood with the song 'Shaamat' from her upcoming film 'Ek Villain Returns' which also features Arjun Kapoor. Rapper Badshah also makes a special appearance in the music video. The song shows snippets of the love story between Tara and Arjun's characters along with Tara's character performing at concerts.

358.title: Calcutta HC asks police to trace pig stolen from district court
358.article_body: The Calcutta High Court on Friday ordered Nadia District Police to launch an investigation to trace 'Ghana', the missing pig who used to live on the premises of Kalyani Court. Four men allegedly stole Ghana on March 25, 2022. A lawyer of the district court said a police complaint had been lodged earlier, however, the police took no action.

359.title: Girl injured as rhino attacks her in Kaziranga National Park
359.article_body: A girl was injured on Saturday after a rhino attacked her in Assam's Kaziranga National Park and Tiger Reserve. The girl, identified as Priya Chowra, hails from the Hatikhuli area near the park. She is undergoing treatment at Bokakhat Hospital, a forest range officer said. The incident took place at the Haldibari corridor near the Hatikhuli area of the park.

360.title: Ban on photography, videography in K'taka govt offices withdrawn
360.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Saturday said the government has withdrawn the ban on photography and videography in all government offices across the state. The order was withdrawn after activists and Opposition parties criticised the move. Karnataka State Government Employees Association alleged that employees were harassed by certain people shooting videos and photos in government offices.

361.title: Senior opposition leader in Russia sentenced to 4 years in prison
361.article_body: A senior opposition leader in Russia has been sentenced to four years in prison for allegedly "directing an undesirable organisation". Andrei Pivovarov, former chief of the political group Open Russia, has denied the charges, saying they were made as he was planning to run for Parliament. Opposition leader Alexei Navalny was jailed earlier in January 2021.

362.title: Where is church priest & Imam: DMK MP at govt 'bhoomi pujan' event
362.article_body: DMK MP S Senthilkumar objected to a 'bhoomi pujan' for a government road project which was being prepared to be held only by a Hindu priest in Tamil Nadu's Dharmapuri. Pointing to the priest, he said, "Where are the other religions? Where is the Christian and the Muslim? Invite the Church father, the Imam...the atheists [and representatives of] Dravidar Kazhagam."

363.title: US will not walk away from Middle East: Biden in Saudi Arabia
363.article_body: Speaking at a summit of Arab leaders in Saudi Arabia on Saturday, US President Joe Biden said, "We'll not walk away and leave a vacuum to be filled by China, Russia or Iran." "We'll seek to build on this moment with active, principled, American leadership," he added. Notably, this was Biden's first trip to the Middle East as the President.

364.title: Only change I'm expecting in 3rd ODI is Arshdeep for Krishna: Zaheer
364.article_body: Ahead of third India-England ODI, Zaheer Khan said he doesn't expect any changes in India's playing XI. He added that, however, the only change he is expecting is inclusion of Arshdeep Singh and whether he would replace Prasidh Krishna to get that swing at Old Trafford. Match will be played on Sunday. The three-match series is currently tied at 1-1.

365.title: 'Kisan Putra', known for his humility: PM on NDA's Vice President candidate Dhankhar
365.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday called West Bengal Governor and NDA's Vice President of India candidate Jagdeep Dhankhar a "Kisan Putra" (son of a farmer). "Jagdeep Dhankhar Ji is known for his humility...He has always worked for the well-being of farmers, youth, women and the marginalised," said PM. "[I'm] glad that he (Dhankhar) will be our VP candidate," he added.

366.title: Suryakumar should certainly bat at no. 4: RP Singh ahead of 3rd ODI
366.article_body: RP Singh said India batter Suryakumar Yadav should certainly bat at number four in third India-England ODI. "If a player is in form, then his position shouldn't be tinkered with at that point," he added. Batting at number four, Suryakumar scored his maiden international century(117) in third T20I against England. Suryakumar, while batting at number five, hit 27 at Lord's.

367.title: Sri Lanka rations fuel amid shortage due to economic crisis
367.article_body: Sri Lanka on Saturday introduced a fuel rationing scheme amid a shortage due to an economic crisis in the country. "A guaranteed weekly fuel quota will be allocated," Sri Lanka's Power and Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera tweeted. Separately, Wijesekera said that the Sri Lankan government has requested various countries to provide the country with fuel supplies amid the crisis.

368.title: Kevin Spacey dropped from Genghis Khan film amid sexual assault charges
368.article_body: Actor Kevin Spacey has been dropped from '1242: Gateway To The West' amid the charges of sexual assault against him in UK. The film is a historical drama about a holy man in a Hungarian castle that fights to stop Genghis Khan's armies from invading Europe. Spacey has denied the allegations against him and travelled to UK to face charges.

369.title: Ranbir, Kartik, Kriti named most stylish at HT India's Most Stylish 2022
369.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor was named Most Stylish Superstar at HT India's Most Stylish 2022 awards. Kartik Aaryan and Kriti Sanon won the awards for India's Most Stylish male and female, respectively. Arjun Kapoor and Malaika Arora won for Most Stylish Couple. Style Legend awards were given to Anil Kapoor and Raveena Tandon. Pankaj Tripathi won the Style With Substance award.

370.title: How does the medal tally look after Day 1 of World Athletics Championships 2022?
370.article_body: Japan are on top of medal standings after Day 1 of World Athletics Championships 2022. Japan bagged a gold medal and a silver medal to top the standings after the first day. Japan are followed by Dominican Republic and Peru, who won one gold medal each. Netherlands and Poland are joint-fourth, having won a silver medal each on Day 1.

371.title: Space for opposition diminishing, not sign of healthy democracy: CJI
371.article_body: Chief Justice of India (CJI) NV Ramana on Saturday said, "Political opposition should not translate into hostility...These are not signs of a healthy democracy." "There used to be mutual respect between government and opposition. Unfortunately, space for opposition is diminishing," he added. "Sadly, the country is witnessing a decline in the quality of legislative performance," the CJI said.

372.title: Bill Gates once took 'my girls' at a Las Vegas bar, says billionaire Mark Cuban
372.article_body: Billionaire Shark Tank judge Mark Cuban jokingly recounted how a then newly wealthy Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates 'stole' some 'girls' he was buying drinks for at a Las Vegas bar. "This was right when Microsoft went public...[The girls said], 'I've got to go to the bathroom.'...And then they don't come back...Bill Gates took my girls!" said Cuban in a podcast.

373.title: 21-yr-old Tomar wins gold in Men's 50m Rifle 3 Positions at Shooting WC
373.article_body: Indian shooter Aishwary Pratap Singh Tomar won a gold medal in Men's 50m Rifle 3 Positions at ISSF World Cup after beating Hungarian Zalan Pekler 16-12 in gold medal match on Saturday in Changwon, Korea. The 21-year-old junior world champion had topped the qualification round with a score of 593. India are currently on top of standings with four golds.

374.title: UP man held captive by Saudi employer for over 1 yr returns home
374.article_body: A 35-year-old man returned to his village in Uttar Pradesh on Friday after spending over one year in the captivity of his employer in Saudi Arabia, police said on Saturday. Rakesh Upadhyay's return was made possible due to the Indian Embassy's intervention. Upadhyay had arrived in Saudi Arabia to work as a plumber in 2019 on a two-year contract.

375.title: Jagdeep Dhankhar named as NDA candidate for post of Vice President of India
375.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda on Saturday announced that West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar is NDA's candidate for the post of the Vice-President of India. The announcement was made after a BJP parliamentary board meeting held in Delhi. Dhankhar is a "kisan putra" (son of a farmer) who established himself as "people's governor", Nadda said.

376.title: Power of noise cancellation: Sushmita as she shares new post after dating announcement
376.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen took to Instagram to share a picture from Maldives. "Ah Serenity & the power of noise cancellation!!! #trulyblessed," she wrote in the picture's caption. The actress had earlier shared a post after former IPL Chairman Lalit Modi confirmed that they are dating, wherein she wrote, "I am in a happy place!!! Not married...No rings...Enough clarification given."

377.title: Too early to say if Kohli can make it to India XI for T20 WC 2022: Karim
377.article_body: Amid Virat Kohli's poor form, Saba Karim said it's too early to question the batter's place in India's playing XI for T20 World Cup, beginning October 16, as there's a lot of time before the tournament starts. "He's fighting his own battle...team management shouldn't pay heed to the criticism and believe in his process to return to...form," he added.

378.title: 51 lakh households will not have to pay for electricity in Punjab: CM
378.article_body: Around 51 lakh households in Punjab will not have to pay their electricity bills due to the scheme that provides 300 units of power for free, Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann said on Saturday. He also said that the scheme had been implemented from July 1. The scheme will cost the Punjab government ₹1,800 crore, according to the state budget.

379.title: 6 dead, 71 hospitalised after diarrhoea outbreak in Odisha's Rayagada
379.article_body: At least six people died and 71 others were hospitalised in the last three days due to diarrhoea after allegedly drinking contaminated water from open sources in several villages in Odisha's Rayagada district, officials said on Saturday. A team of 11 doctors visited the affected villages and collected water and blood samples and sent those for examination.

380.title: Many SC lawyers charge ₹10-15 lakh/hearing, how can a common man afford it?: Rijiju
380.article_body: Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju on Saturday talked about the high fees charged by Supreme Court lawyers which he said can go up to ₹10-15 lakh per hearing. "How can a common man afford it?" asked Rijiju, adding, "The court should not be only for the privileged." He said, "I believe the doors of justice should be open to all."

381.title: Gang dealing in stolen phones busted in Mumbai, 480 mobiles seized
381.article_body: Mumbai Police on Saturday claimed to have busted a gang dealing in stolen mobiles, arresting two men and seizing around 480 phones from them, including iPhones. Besides the mobiles, a laptop, 9.5 kg marijuana, 174 foreign liquor bottles and two swords were seized in the raids at suburban Mankhurd. Total value of seized material was around ₹75 lakh.

382.title: Charges against Ahmed Patel mischievous: Jairam Ramesh
382.article_body: Congress General Secretary Jairam Ramesh has stated that the party refutes the "mischievous" charges "manufactured" against its late leader Ahmed Patel. He added, "This is...Prime Minister's...strategy to absolve himself of any responsibility for the communal carnage unleashed [in Gujarat in 2002]." Patel has been accused of being involved in a conspiracy to topple the Gujarat government in 2002.

383.title: Sukumar Garu said 'Everyone has to walk like you': Allu Arjun on 'Pushpa' walk
383.article_body: Speaking about his tilted-shoulder walk in 'Pushpa: The Rise', actor Allu Arjun said that he was told by Sukumar Garu, "I don't know what you do but everybody has to walk like you." The actor added he came up with the tilted-shoulder walk thinking it would be "easily imitable". Allu had earlier said that the walk hurt his shoulder joint.

384.title: My CA asked me to prepare will, I was like 'Am I going to die?': Ranbir
384.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has said that his CA recently asked him to prepare a will, adding, "I was like, 'Will?...Am I going to die? Why would I make a will at this age?'" The actor further said that he doesn't think about things like that. "Right now I'm only thinking about the excitement of having a child," he added.

385.title: I have no work, no money; should I suffocate myself to death: Neetu Chandra
385.article_body: Actress Neetu Chandra stated in an interview that she has no work and no money, adding that she feels unwanted in the industry. "Should I suffocate myself to death? Does a person's worth become known only after their demise?" the actress added. Neetu cited late actor Sushant Singh Rajput's example, saying that the thought of suicide has crossed her mind.

386.title: Pietersen shares pic with Kohli, says 'There's way more than just the bubble of cricket'
386.article_body: Ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen shared a picture of himself with Virat Kohli and penned a note in support of the ex-India captain. "Buddy...your career has had some of the best that have played...only wish they could've done what you've (so far). Be proud...walk tall & enjoy life. There's way more than just the bubble of cricket...You'll be back," he wrote.

387.title: Virat Kohli responds to Babar Azam's 'Stay strong' tweet, says 'Keep shining'
387.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli has responded to Pakistan captain Babar Azam's 'This too shall pass, stay strong' tweet. Kohli wrote, "Thank you. Keep shining and rising. Wish you all the best." Reacting to it, a fan tweeted, "This is called sportsman spirit." Another Twitter user wrote, "Love these gestures."

388.title: Defending long jump champion Gayle crashes out of World Athletics C'ships
388.article_body: Defending champion Tajay Gayle of Jamaica failed to qualify for the long jump final at World Athletics Championships after committing three fouls in qualification in Eugene, Oregon. The 25-year-old from Jamaica was unable to record a legal jump at Hayward Field on Friday. Gayle has not jumped past 8 metres this year and reportedly suffered a bone bruise weeks earlier.

389.title: Gang of thieves burgles 12 houses in 2 days in Pune
389.article_body: A gang of thieves burgled 12 houses in Pune's Parmar Co-operative Housing Society and Shraddha Regency Building between July 13 and 14, police officials said. Sub-inspector Ajay Bhosale said the house locks were broken using iron rods. A man named Shailesh Bafna filed an FIR with the police regarding all the burglaries.

390.title: 26-yr-old man run over by bus after his bike hits pothole in Thane
390.article_body: A 26-year-old man died on Saturday after his motorbike hit a pothole and he fell in front of a moving public bus in Dombivali-Kalyan, in the Thane district near Mumbai. "Ankit Thaiva was on his way to work in Ghansoli in Navi Mumbai when the incident took place on Katai-Badlapur road near Khoni village," a police official said.

391.title: Iran showcased attack-capable drones to Russian officials: US
391.article_body: Iran had showcased its "attack-capable" drones to Russian officials at Kashan Airfield on June 8 and July 15, US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan said on Saturday. The US earlier this week said it has information that shows Iran is preparing to provide Russia with hundreds of drones for use in Ukraine. Notably, Iran's Foreign Minister had denied US' claim.

392.title: Kartik Aaryan shares 'Shehzada' first look, announces new release date
392.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan shared his first look from the upcoming film 'Shehzada' on social media on Saturday, writing, "#Shehzada Returns Home." The actor also announced that the film, which was scheduled for a November 4 release, will now be released on February 10, 2023. The film is directed by Rohit Dhawan and also features Kriti Sanon and Paresh Rawal.

393.title: 36-yr-old man shot in the face by minor boy in Delhi, incident caught on camera
393.article_body: A 36-year-old man suffered grievous injury in his eye after he was allegedly shot in the face by a minor boy in Delhi's Jahangirpuri area on Friday evening, police said. They have apprehended four minors in the case. "Accused said the man had beaten up the father of one of the minors 7 months back...They [came]...to take revenge," police stated.

394.title: BJP MP's convoy attacked in Telangana, he blames TRS workers
394.article_body: BJP MP Arvind Dharmapuri on Friday alleged that "10-15 goons of TRS (Telangana Rashtra Samithi)" attacked his convoy while he was visiting a village in Telangana. Dharmapuri claimed the assailants were sent by an MLA who didn't want the villagers to highlight the issue of a land scam. Police haven't confirmed if the assailants were TRS members, a report said.

395.title: It's a Test, not a T20I: Akmal on Pak's team selection for 1st Test vs SL
395.article_body: Veteran Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Kamran Akmal has questioned Pakistan's team selection for the first Test against Sri Lanka, saying it's pretty shocking why Fawad Alam and Faheem Ashraf both have been dropped. "It's a Test match not a T20I game...too many all-rounders playing and what I think is, a Test match game is all about specialists," he tweeted.

396.title: Sonia Gandhi behind plot to frame Narendra Modi in Guj riots: BJP
396.article_body: The BJP on Saturday alleged Congress President Sonia Gandhi was the "driving force" behind the "conspiracy" to implicate then Gujarat CM Narendra Modi in the 2002 riots case in the state. Party spokesperson Sambit Patra said, "Through her (Sonia) Chief Political Advisor, late Ahmed Patel, Sonia Gandhi attempted to malign Gujarat's image. Through him, she attempted to insult Narendra Modi."

397.title: Crying fan refuses to leave Shehnaaz Gill at event, video goes viral
397.article_body: A video is going viral on social media which shows a fan hugging actress Shehnaaz Gill at an event and refusing to let her go even as the actress' bodyguards try to separate them. The fan was also crying and kissed Shehnaaz on the cheek. Shehnaaz gave the fan a hug and left only after the fan had gained composure.

398.title: Will work on mistakes from hockey WC, start afresh for CWG: Lalremsiami
398.article_body: Indian women's hockey team forward Lalremsiami said her side will work on the mistakes from the disappointing women's hockey World Cup campaign and start afresh for Commonwealth Games 2022. India finished ninth in the World Cup standings. India will play against Ghana in their first match of Pool A in the Commonwealth Games on July 29.

399.title: Rare 1-in-30 million orange lobster found at US restaurant, pic surfaces
399.article_body: A rare one-in-30 million orange-coloured lobster was found by a restaurant in US' Florida and handed over to an aquarium. A video of 'Cheddar' the lobster being taken from a tank at the Red Lobster restaurant has been shared by the aquarium on Twitter. The restaurant's manager helped rescue the unique shellfish.

400.title: 1st image of damage to world's most powerful telescope from space rock released
400.article_body: A picture of damage to world's most powerful telescope, James Webb Telescope, after being hit by a space rock has been released. The image shows damage to one hexagonal segment of the observatory's main mirror called C3. The micrometeorite strike raised the wavefront error of the segment from 56 nanometres to 178 nanometres after correction by adjusting the segment.

401.title: Video of little girl touching a jawan's feet goes viral
401.article_body: A clip of a little girl touching a jawan's feet at a metro station has gone viral. It was shared by politician PC Mohan on Twitter. "Raising patriotic young minds is a duty every parent owes to this great nation. Jai Hind," he wrote. "This is what we should teach our next generation," a Twitter user commented.

402.title: 2 Pune brothers assault tempo driver after road mishap, FIR filed
402.article_body: Two brothers assaulted a tempo driver after a road mishap between them in Pune. According to the FIR filed on Thursday, Ramesh Pawar's tempo hit the motorbike of Sanket Shedge and his brother. Even though Pawar offered to help with medical treatment, the brothers called their relatives and assaulted Pawar, leaving him unconscious in a pool of rainwater.
